title: Harvard Gains 6.5% in Lackluster Year for College Endowments
text:
Harvard University’s endowment gained 6.5% in fiscal 2019, joining other colleges in a year of lackluster performance.

College endowments are now reporting investment returns for the fiscal year ended in June, and they’re getting beat by the S&P 500, which gained more than 10% in the same period. Harvard’s performance landed in the middle of other wealthy schools, including Ivy League peers Dartmouth College, which gained 7.5%, and the University of Pennsylvania, also up 6.5%.
